body:
I can install and activate the `py-pip` package for `python@2.7.13`.  It fails for `python@3.6.0`. 

I've seen #2065, which discusses why it is not included (in spite of the wisdom from the benevelent dictator community included in [PEP 453](https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0453/)).

I don't see any obvious reason why Spack's own `py-pip` package shouldn't work.

Here's what happens when I try:

```
hartzelg@blah:spack ((b630c067...))$ (module purge; spack install -v py-pip ^python@3.6.0)
==> python is already installed in /scratch/hartzelg/spack-cime-doh-working-dir/workspace/doh-daily-build/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-5.4.0/python-3.6.0-xzcafuxqdimdwtxgm7v3cgqvip3ul4dt
==> py-setuptools is already installed in /scratch/hartzelg/spack-cime-doh-working-dir/workspace/doh-daily-build/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-5.4.0/py-setuptools-34.4.1-6y7yqukbhnckktpgjyym2fgxh4s2xzpe
==> Installing py-pip
==> Using cached archive: /scratch/hartzelg/spack-cime-doh-working-dir/workspace/doh-daily-build/spack/var/spack/cache/py-pip/py-pip-9.0.1.tar.gz
==> Already staged py-pip-9.0.1-xpjyixym6o2qx6hav6s7aghupkb2xyvd in /scratch/hartzelg/spack-cime-doh-working-dir/workspace/doh-daily-build/spack/var/spack/stage/py-pip-9.0.1-xpjyixym6o2qx6hav6s7aghupkb2xyvd
==> Already patched py-pip
==> Building py-pip [PythonPackage]
==> Executing phase : 'build'
==> '/scratch/hartzelg/spack-cime-doh-working-dir/workspace/doh-daily-build/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-5.4.0/python-3.6.0-xzcafuxqdimdwtxgm7v3cgqvip3ul4dt/bin/python3.6' 'setup.py' '--no-user-cfg' 'build'
Traceback (most recent call last):
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 1:
    '/scratch/hartzelg/spack-cime-doh-working-dir/workspace/doh-daily-build/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-5.4.0/python-3.6.0-xzcafuxqdimdwtxgm7v3cgqvip3ul4dt/bin/python3.6' 'setup.py' '--no-user-cfg' 'build'
/scratch/hartzelg/spack-cime-doh-working-dir/workspace/doh-daily-build/spack/lib/spack/spack/build_systems/python.py:129, in python:
     128      def python(self, *args, **kwargs):
  >> 129          inspect.getmodule(self).python(*args, **kwargs)

See build log for details:
  /tmp/hartzelg/spack-stage/spack-stage-7il761/pip-9.0.1/spack-build.out
hartzelg@blah:spack ((b630c067...))$ cat /tmp/hartzelg/spack-stage/spack-stage-7il761/pip-9.0.1/spack-build.out
==> '/scratch/hartzelg/spack-cime-doh-working-dir/workspace/doh-daily-build/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-5.4.0/python-3.6.0-xzcafuxqdimdwtxgm7v3cgqvip3ul4dt/bin/python3.6' 'setup.py' '--no-user-cfg' 'build'
Traceback (most recent call last):
hartzelg@blah:spack ((b630c067...))$
```

My normal trick would be to try to get a better error message, but trying to `spack env ... bash` blows up.  The git-completion thing is something I have in my prompt (trying to be cool...), but it seems like something upstream is exploding.

```
hartzelg@blah:pip-9.0.1$ spack env py-pip^python@3.6.0 bash
ImportError: No module named site
ImportError: No module named site
bash: /share/git-completion.bash: No such file or directory
ImportError: No module named site
bash: /share/git-prompt.sh: No such file or directory
bash: __git_ps1: command not found
[hartzelg@blah pip-9.0.1]$ which python
/usr/bin/python
bash: __git_ps1: command not found
```

Should this work?

Is it obvious what's going wrong?
title: Spack's py-pip does not install for python@3.6.0
